title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 59 (Slavery5)
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 59 (Slavery 5):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Allain (Ed.) -  The Legal Understanding of Slavery; from the Historical to the Contemporary (2012)

-  Andrews (Ed.) - Slave Narratives After Slavery (2011)

-  Baker & Kelly (Eds.) - After Slavery; Race, Labor, and Citizenship in the Reconstruction South (2013)

-  Bessel et al (Eds.) - War, Empire and Slavery, 1770-1830 (2010)

-  Brennan & Packer (Eds.) - Colonialism, Slavery, Reparations and Trade; Remedying the Past (2012)

-  Campbell (Ed.) - The Laws of Slavery in Texas (2010)

-  Chanter - Whose Antigone; the Tragic Marginalization of Slavery (2011)

-  Davies - American Scenes and Christian Slavery; a Recent Tour of Four Thousand Miles in the United States (1849, 2009)

-  Davis - The Problem of Slavery in the Age of Revolution 1770-1823 (1999)

-  Diptee - From Africa to Jamaica; the Making of an Atlantic Slave Society, 1775-1807 (2010)

-  Douglass - My Bondage and My Freedom (1855, 2005)

-  Drescher - Econocide; British Slavery in the Era of Abolition, 2e (2010)

-  Foner - Gateway to Freedom; the Hidden History of the Underground Railroad (2015)

-  Ford - The Underground Railroad and Slavery Through Primary Sources (2013)

-  Fountain - Slavery, Civil War and Salvation; African American Slaves and Christianity, 1830-1870 (2010)

-  Hazen - American Black History (2004)

-  Hochschild - Bury the Chains; Prophets and Rebels in the Fight to Free an Empire's Slaves (2005)

-  Horton & Horton - Slavery and the Making of America (2005)

-  Kiple - The Caribbean Slave; a Biological History (1984)

-  Lawrance - Amistad's Orphans; an Atlantic Story of Children, Slavery, and Smuggling (2014)

-  Marsico - Slavery; a Chapter in American History (2014)

-  Martinez - The Slave Trade and the Origins of International Human Rights Law (2012)

-  Merriam - The Negro and the Nation; A History of American Slavery and Enfranchisement

-  Miller - Arguing About Slavery; the Great Battle in the Unites States Congress (1996)

-  Pargas - The Quarters and the Fields; Slave Families in the Non-Cotton South (2010)

-  Reynolds - Righteous Violence; Revolution, Slavery, and the American Renaissance (2011)

-  Rothman - Beyond Freedom's Reach; a Kidnapping in the Twilight of Slavery (2015)

-  Schwartz - Born in Bondage; Growing Up Enslaved in the Antebellum South (2000)

-  Sharfstein - The Invisible Line; Three American Families and the Secret Journey from Black to White (2011)

-  Sheridan - Doctors and Slaves; a Medical and Demographic History of Slavery in the British West Indies, 1680-1834 (1985)

-  Smithers - Slave Breeding; Sex, Violence, and Memory in African American History (2012)

-  Walvin - The Zong; a Massacre, the Law & the End of Slavery (2011)

-  Wiencek - Master of the Mountain; Thomas Jefferson and His Slaves (2012)

-  Winch - Between Slavery and Freedom; Free People of Color in America from Settlement to the Civil War (2014)

-  Wright - Slavery and American Economic Development (2006)
